Two steps necessary to promote the big lie.  (1) reduce an issue to a simple black-and-white choice that 'even the most feebleminded could understand.'. (2) second is to 'repeat the oversimplification over and over.'.
Author: Fritz Hipplers

Comment: It's not that I have something to hide, I have nothing I want you to see
When stupidity is considered patriotism, it is unsafe to be intelligent
Author: Isaac Asimov

Comment: 'Mark my word, if and when these preachers get control of the [Republican] party, and they're sure trying to do so, it's going to be a terrible damn problem. Frankly, these people frighten me. Politics and governing demand compromise. But these Christians believe they are acting in the name of God, so they can't and won't compromise. I know, I've tried to deal with them…
Author: Barry Goldwater 1994

Comment: The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason. Proverbs 26:16, King James Bible  The lazy man is wiser in his own eyes Than seven men who can answer sensibly.
Author: Proverbs 26:16, New King James Bible

Comment: 'Arguing that you don't care about the right to privacy because you have nothing to hide, is no different than saying you don't care about free speech because you have nothing to say'
Author: Edward Snowden

Comment: Sunset is still my favorite color, and rainbow is second. – Mattie Stepanek
It's better to be a warrior in a garden than a gardener in a war
Author: Chinese Proverb

Comment: I don’t count my sit-ups. I only start counting when it starts hurting. That is when I start counting, because then it really counts. That’s what makes you a champion.
Author: Muhammad Ali

Comment: It's not that I have something to hide, I have nothing I want you to see.'
Author: last line of movie Anon

Comment: the bitterness of poor quality remains long after the sweetness of low price is forgotten
Author: Ben Franklin

Comment: The prudent see danger and take refuge, but the simple keep going and suffer for it.
Author: Proverbs 27:12

Comment: Before I leave I'd like to see our politics begin to return to the purposes and practices that distinguish our history from the history of other nations.  I would like to see us recover our sense that we are more alike than different.  We are citizens of a republic made of shared ideals forged in a new world to replace the tribal enmities that tormented the old one.  Even in times of political turmoil such as these, we share that awesome heritage and the responsibility to embrace it.
Author: John McCain

Comment: 'If by a 'Liberal' they mean someone who looks ahead and not behind, someone who welcomes new ideas without rigid reactions, someone who cares about the welfare of the people-their health, their housing, their schools, their jobs, their civil rights and their civil liberties-someone who believes we can break through the stalemate and suspicions that grip us in our policies abroad, if that is what they mean by a 'Liberal', then I'm proud to say I'm a 'Liberal.'
Author: John F. Kennedy

Comment: Life should not be a journey to the grave with the intention of arriving safely in a pretty and well preserved body, but rather to skid in broadside in a cloud of smoke, thoroughly used up, totally worn out, and loudly proclaiming 'Wow!  What a Ride!'
Author: Hunter S. Thompson

Comment: A nation of slaves is always prepared to applaud the clemency of their master who, in the abuse of absolute power, does not proceed to the last extremes of injustice and oppression.
Author: Edward Gibbon in Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire:

Comment: Egotism is the anesthetic that dulls the pain of stupidity.
Author: Frank Leahy

Comment: 'A good plan violently executed now is better than a perfect plan executed next week.'
Author: George S. Patton

Comment: Do not develop an attachment to any one weapon or any one school of fighting.
Author: Miyamoto Musashi

Comment: What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear...
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Comment: Gentlemen, we will chase perfection, and we will chase it relentlessly, knowing all the while we can never attain it.  But along the way, we shall catch excellence.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Comment: In seeking truth you have to get both sides of a story
Author: Walter Cronkite

Comment: God wants spiritual fruits not religious nuts
Blessed are the flexable, for they shall not be bent out of shape
Growing old is mandatory, growing up is optional
'When the power of love overcomes the love of power the world will know peace.'
Author: Jimi Hendrix

Comment: I do not believe in taking away the right of the citizen for sporting, for hunting and so forth, or for home defense.  But I do believe that an AK-47, a machine gun, is not a sporting weapon or needed for defense of a home.
Author: Ronald Reagan, at his birthday celebration in 1989.

Comment: During times of war, hatred becomes quite respectable, even though it has to masquerade often under the guise of patriotism.
Author: Howard Thurman

Comment: The world is my country, all mankind are my brethren, and to do good is my religion. - Thomas Paine

rather than talking about putting up a fence why dont we make it possible for them to come here legally with a work permit then while they are working here, they pay taxes here and when they want to go back, they can go back. The can cross, open the border both ways
Author: Reagon - 1980 presendental debate

Comment: I support the idea of tuition tax credits and a loan program
Author: Ronald Reagon

Comment: I am the only person who has run for this job who was a six times president of the union and still has a life time membership in the union
Author: Ronald Reagon

Comment: I too, am pledged to a social security program that will reasure these senior citizens of ours that they will continue to get their money.
Author: Ronald Reagon

Comment:
I laugh at all that the computer rules
I laugh at all that I see
I laugh as I teach the computer the think
cause it sure as hell won't rule me
The secret of freedom lies in educating people, whereas the secret of tyranny is in keeping them ignorant.
Author: Maximilien Robespierre

Comment: The man who views the world at 50 the same as he did at 20 has wasted 30 years of his life.
Author: Muhammad Ali

Comment:
Many politicians make it clear they don't care who dies, so long as the wealthy and corporations pay less in taxes.
They don't care when people die from lack of medical care.
They don't care when women die from backroom abortions.
They don't care when soldiers die in pointless wars.
They don't care when citizens die in war, or industrial hazard, or from a failure to plan well,
or from poor infrastructure, or from a lack of education, or from bad water, food or air.
They don't care when the harassed die from murder or suicide.
They don't care about "Government of the people by the people for the people."
It's still your choice.
Author: Laurie Mann

Comment: at tells people that when they harvest the land, they should leave some 'for the poor and the alien'
Author: Leviticus 19:9-10

Comment: If there be among you a poor man of one of thy brethren within any of thy gates in thy land which the LORD thy God giveth thee, thou shalt not harden thine heart, nor shut thine hand from thy poor brother
Author: Deuteronomy 15:7 KJV

Comment: Pride goeth before destruction, and an haughty spirit before a fall.
Author: Proverbs 16:18

Comment: I may not have gone where I intended to go, but I think I have ended up where I intended to be.
Author: Douglas Adams

Comment: Our task must be to free ourselves from this prison by widening our circle of compassion, to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature in its beauty.
Author: Albert Einstein

Comment:
Never get your honey where you make your money.
Never get your bread and butter from the same place.
Never get your meat from the same place you get your bread.
Author: people

Comment: Of all the tyrannies, a tyranny exercised for the good of it's victims may be the most oppressive. It may be better to live under Robber Barons than under omnipotent moral busybodies. The robber Baron's cruelty may sometimes sleep, his cupidity may at some point be satiated, but those who torment us for our own good will torment us without end, for they do so with the approval of their consciences.
Author: C.S. Lewis or - H.L. Mencken

Comment: To announce that there must be no criticism of the president, or that we are to stand by the president right or wrong, is not only unpatriotic and servile, but is morally treasonable to the American public.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Comment: History teaches that war begins when governments believe the price of aggression is cheap.
Author: Ronald Reagan

Comment: War is Peace. Freedom is Slavery. Ignorance is Strength.
Author: Big Brother

Comment: Naturally, the common people don't want war ...  but after all it is the leaders of a country who determine the policy, and it is always a simple matter to drag the people along, whether it is a democracy, or a fascist dictatorship, or a parliament, or a communist dictatorship.  All you have to do is to tell them they are being attacked, and denounce the pacifists for lack of patriotism and exposing the country to danger.  It works the same in every country.
Author: Hermann Goering

Comment: 'The most powerful weapon in the hands of the oppressor is the mind of the oppressed.'
Author: Stephen Biko

Comment: 'You have zero privacy, anyway'
Author: Scott McNealy, Sun Microsystems

Comment: It's frustrating when you know all the answers, but nobody bothers To ask you the questions.
Today's mighty oak is just yesterday's nut that held its ground.
THE FOUR STAGES OF LIFE:   1)    You believe in Santa Claus.   2)    You don't believe in Santa Claus.   3)    You are Santa Claus.   4)    You look like Santa Claus.
Raising teenagers is like nailing Jell-O to a tree.
Core values: Respect, Integrity, Communication and Excellence.
Author: Enron

Comment: Terrorism is often the outcome of that fanatic fundamentalism which springs from the conviction that one's own vision of the truth must be forced upon everyone else.  Instead, even when the truth has been reached, it can never be imposed.
Author: Pope John-Paul II 2002

Comment: Not everything that can be counted counts, and not everything that counts can be counted.
A point in every direction is the same as no point at all.
Author: Harry Nilsson (The pointless Man )

Comment: Whoever fights monsters should see to it that they do not become monsters
'I want you to remember that no bastard ever won a war by dying for his country.  He won it by making the other poor dumb bastard die for his country'
Author: General George S. Patton '44

Comment: All generalizations are false.
May God stand between you and harm in all the empty places you must visit.
He who laughs last thinks slowest

Comparing information and knowledge is like asking whether the fatness of a pig is more or less green than the designated hitter rule.
Author: - David Guaspari

Comment: To be nobody-but-yourself -- in a world which is doing its best, night and day, to make you everybody else -- means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight; and never stop fighting. - e.e. cummings

When I examine myself and my methods of thought, I come to the conclusion that the gift of fantasy has meant more to me than my talent for absorbing positive knowledge.                                    -- Einstein
Man will occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of the time he will pick himself up and continue on.
Author: Churchill's Commentary on Man

Comment: Insert famous quote here
Computers are useless.  They can only give you answers.
Author: Pablo Picasso (1881-1973)

Comment: Anyone who goes to a psychiatrist ought to have his head examined.
Author: Samuel Goldwyn

Comment:
When they took the fourth amendment,
I was quiet because I didn't deal drugs.
When they took the sixth amendment,
I was quiet because I was innocent.
When they took the second amendment,
I was quiet because I didn't own a gun.
Now they've taken the first amendment,
and I can say nothing about it.
Author: Tim Freeman

Comment: All the world's indeed a stage.  And we are merely players, performers and portrayers...
Author: Rush

Comment: If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it'.
Author: A. Einstein

Comment: I cannot believe that God would choose to play dice with the world.
Author: A. Einstein

Comment: Men are disturbed not by things that happen but by their opinion of things that happen.
Author: Epictetus

Comment: There are none so blind as those who will not see.
Author: Dylan Thomas(?)

Comment: There are none so blind as those who will not see.
Author: John Heywood, in 1546.

Comment: Therefore speak I to them in parables: because they seeing see not; and hearing they hear not, neither do they understand
Author: Matthew 13:13 KJV

Comment: Never mistake motion for action.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Comment: I have sworn upon the altar of God, eternal hostility against every form of tyranny over the mind of man.
Author: Thomas Jefferson, 1780

Comment: 'If a nation expects to be ignorant & free, in a state of civilization, it expects what never was & never will be.'
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Comment: The best morale exist when you rarely hear the word mentioned. When you hear a lot of talk about it, it's usually very poor.
Author: General Eisenhower

Comment: Zat was Zen, dis is Tao.
Don't tell me how many storms you have weathered, just how many ships you have brought to port!
Author: Anonymous

Comment: The Titanic was built by professionals, the ark by amateurs.
It means just what I chose it to mean, neither more, nor less.
Author: Humpty Dumpty

Comment: What the world needs is not dogma but an attitude of scientific inquiry combined with a belief that the torture of millions is not desirable, whether inflicted by Stalin or by a Deity imagined in the likeness of the believer.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Comment: Il primo amore non si scorda mai
Author: Old italian proverb

Comment: An armed society is a polite society.
Author: Robert Heinlein

Comment: It is not only vain, but wicked, in a legislator to frame laws in opposition to the laws of nature, and to arm them with the terrors of death.  This is truly creating crimes in order to punish them.
Author: Thomas Jefferson, 1779

Comment: Travel is the act of leaving familiarity behind. Destination is merely a by-product of the journey.
'The Tough Coughs as He Ploughs the Dough'
Author: Dr. Theodor (Seuss) Geisel

Comment: They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Comment: Far better it is to dare mighty things, to win glorious triumphs, even though checkered by failure, than to take rank with those poor spirits who neither enjoy much nor suffer much, because they live in the gray twilight that knows not victory or defeat.
Author: Teddy Roosevelt

Comment: Age and treachery will always overcome youth and skill
Statistics are often used in the same way that a drunk uses a light pole. For support rather than illumination.

Nothing really matters and even if it did, so what'

Comment: Mob rule isn't any prettier merely because the mob calls itself a government.

Comment: Angels are able to fly because they take themselves so lightly.
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Comment: You live, you grow, the more you do, the more you know.
Author: Q.V.Franklin

Comment: Judge a person, not by the quality of their piss, but rather the quality of their work.
Author: Q.V.Franklin

Comment: The true nature of evil is evident in the desire of one person to control another person.
Author: Q.V.Franklin

Comment: The desire of one person to control and dictate to another person is the true form of evil.
Author: Q.V.Franklin

Comment: Who are they all'  There is a horde of them!  Ah, I know you.  All of my old enemies!  Falsehood, Cowardice, Compromise.  I know you'll get the upper hand.  Nevermind.  I'll fight on, and on, and on!  You take everything, the laurel and the rose too!  Go on, take them.  But, in spite of you, one thing goes with me now, my panache.
Author: Cyrano de Bergerac, Dying speech! (Edmund Rostand)

Comment: Facts are such a nuisance to track down, and half the time they don't even support your theory and have to be thrown out anyway!
Author: Mark VanTassel

Comment: Asked what he thought of Western civilization, Gandhi said, 'I think it would be an excellent idea'.

Resistance to change is caused by
(1) avoiding the thought of changing
(2) maintaining stability
(3) Getting even with the company
(4) well intentioned people who happen to be wrong.
[Pg 4 Employee Handbook for Organizational Change (Pritchett & Pound) Given to IBM employees at RTP]
Resistance is futile - Borg
Nowhere is the option that the change might cost money, or the resistance might be in the best interest of the corporation
Author: Q.V. Franklin

Comment: You can't win, you can't break even, you can't even quit
Author: Ginsberg's theorem

Comment: Cheap, Quick or Good.  For any product, you can choose two.
Accusing workers of resisting change is an effective method some managers use to maintain the status quo.  In many cases these workers are the very people trying to implement changes.
Author: Q.V.Franklin

Comment: Eagles don't flock.  You have to find them one at a time.
Author: H. Ross Perot

Comment: Appropriate Inspirational Quote

Comment: A dam restricts the flow of water to generate electric power, while a bureaucrat restricts the flow of progress to generate personal power.
Author: Q.V.Franklin

Comment: You're only young once, but you can be immature forever.

The major difference between a thing that might go wrong and a thing that cannot possibly go wrong is that when a thing that cannot possibly go wrong goes wrong it usually turns out to be impossible to get at or repair.
Author: Douglas Adams

Comment: Schroedinger's cat died quietly and alone when a tree silently fell on him.  There were no witnesses but those who know the cat well say he went into the forest of his own free will.
Author: Don Peter

Comment: 'We trained hard, but it seemed that every time we were beginning to form up into teams, we would be reorganized.  I was to learn later in life, that we tend to meet any new situation by reorganizing, and a wonderful method it can be for creating the illusion of progress, while only producing confusion, inefficiency and demoralization.'
Author: Petronius Arbiter 66 AD

Comment: Within any autocratic system, empowerment of the people requires the removal of the autocrats.
Author: Q.V.Franklin

Comment: 'Everything should be made as simple as possible, but not simpler.'
Author: Albert Einstein

Comment: The average user doesn't know a CONFIG.SYS from a fig newton.
'THUNK' is the sound a programmer's head makes when he has spent the day fiddling with 16/32 bit math, and he faints on his desk <*grin*>.
Author: Glen Fine

Comment: Resist much. Obey little.
Author: Walt Whitman

Comment: Basic Principle of Life: What you feed lives.......What you starve dies.
Bad spellers of the world, UNIETE!
If at first you don't succeed, try doing it your own way
Author: Q.V.Franklin

Comment: Help fight truth decay

'was once asked how long he needed to prepare a speech. He replied that it depended on how long the speech was to be. 'If you want me to speak for fifteen minutes, then I will need at least two weeks to prepare. If you want me to speak for half an hour, then I'll need a week to prepare. If you want me to speak for two hours, then I'm ready now.'
Author: Various from Woodrow Wilson  to Abraham Lincoln

Comment: 'I apologize for this long letter, but I had not the time to write a short letter'
Author: Ben Franklin

Comment: Time flies like the wind, fruit flies like bananas.
To understand recursion, you must first understand recursion.
There is no noun that cannot be verbed
Poets, Priest and Politicians, have words to thank for their position. Words that scream for your submission, no one's jamming their transmission.

Comment: Political Correctness is another form of prejudice -- Q.V.Franklin
Select honesty over correctness -- Q.V.Franklin
Only those causing problems say 'Your either part of the problem or part of the solution.'                           -- Q.V.Franklin
Any technician can create a Thing.   But it requires a good manager to take credit for that Thing.

Comment: Corruption of conformity is a requirement for progressive improvement.
Author: Q.V.Franklin

Comment: The potential to do a thing does not imply a requirement to do that thing
Author: Q.V.Franklin

Comment: Judge them not by who they blame, but by what they produce.

Discretion: Putting two and two together and keeping your mouth shut.
Diplomacy: Being able to jump into troubled waters without making a splash.
Subtlety: Saying what you want to say and then getting a safe distance away before it's understood.
Tact: The art of making a point without making an enemy.
He who laughs, lasts.
Russian proverb: If you tickle yourself, you can laugh when you please.
A Puritan is someone who is deathly afraid that someone somewhere is having fun.
When your only tool is a hammer, you tend to treat everything you find like a nail.
It is easier to fight for one's principles than to live up to them.
For indeed, he that preaches to those that have ears but hear not, makes of himself a nuisance. - Chaucer, The Tales of Melibeus
Have fingers, will type.  Have brain, will think.
The problem with making software idiot-proof is that the idiots are so '@#&%! clever.
Have a day. :-|
For those of you who consider life to be a joke, consider the punch line.
Author: anon

Comment: The society which scorns excellence in plumbing because it is a humble activity and tolerates shoddiness in philosophy because it is an exalted activity will have neither good plumbing nor good philosophy.  Neither its pipes nor its theories will hold water -- John W.  Gardner
Abstract art does have value; it's a Rorschach test for pretentiousness.
Question identity.
Question authority.
Question bureaucracy.
'It would be thought a hard government that should tax its people one tenth part...' -- Ben Franklin
If the human brain were so simple that we could understand it, we would be so simple we couldn't.

A science is said to be useful if its development tends to accentuate the existing inequalities in the distribution of wealth, or more directly promotes the destruction of human life. -- Godfrey H. Hardy
If computers are the wave of the future, displays are the surfboards.
'Passwords are like underwear,' she said, 'Both should be changed often.'
Author: Bennett Falk in "Mom Meets Unix"

Comment: Your karma just ran over my dogma!
I'd rather have artificial intelligence than natural stupidity.
The Eagle may soar, but the Weasel never gets sucked into a jet intake.
Kirk to Enterprise: 'I've beamed down and I can't get up!'
Star Trek newsflash:  Enterprise power source is Foulger's Crystals.
Star Trek VIII: Federation Family Feud
Nobody's perfec.
Intel - putting the backwards in backwards compatibility.
Any sufficiently advanced bureaucracy is indistinguishable from molasses.
Abrams's Advice:  When eating an elephant, take one bite at a time.
Rule of Accuracy:  When working toward the solution of a problem, it always helps if you know the answer.
Acheson's Rule of the Bureaucracy: A memorandum is written not to inform the reader but to protect the writer.
Acton's Law:  Power tends to corrupt; absolute power corrupts absolutely.
Ade's Law:  Anybody can win - unless there happens to be a second entry.
Allen's Law of Civilization:  It is better for civilization to be going down the drain than to be coming up it.
Bradley's Bromide:  If computers get too powerful, we can organize them into a committee - that will do them in.
Anderson's Law:  I have yet to see any problem, however complicated, which, when you looked at it in the right way, did not become still more complicated.
Barth's Distinction:  There are two classes of people:  those who divide people into two classes, and those who don't.
Bartz's Law of Hokey Horsepuckery:  The more ridiculous a belief system, the higher the probability of its success.

Baxter's First Law:  Government intervention in the free market always leads to a lower national standard of living. Q.V.Franklin's response:  The free market is a system designed to manipulate man's greed for the common good of mankind.  The government's job is to provide and enforce the rules for this manipulation. Therefore, government intervention is required by a free market.
Beauregard's First Law:  When you're up to your nose, keep your mouth shut.
Thoughts on reality : The trouble with having both feet on the ground is that it brings one into unbearably close contact with the world.
Author: Thomas Szasz, "Heresies"

Comment: Beware of people who tell you that a little knowledge is a dangerous thing - unless they quickly add that no knowledge is a fatal thing. They are trying to make you more vulnerable, not more wise.
Author: Thomas Szasz, "Heresies"

Comment: Bok's Law:  If you think education is expensive - try ignorance.
Boyle's Observation:  A welfare state is one that assumes responsibility for the health, happiness, and general well-being of all its citizens except the taxpayers.
Booker's Law:  An ounce of application is worth a ton of abstraction.
Borstelmann's Rule:  If everything seems to be coming your way, you're probably in the wrong lane.
Brien's First Law:  At some time in the life cycle of virtually every organization, its ability to succeed in spite of itself runs out.
Brooks's Law:  Adding manpower to a late software project makes it later.
Burns's Balance:  If the assumptions are wrong, the conclusions aren't likely to be very good.
Have you ever shopped for a house, and asked the builder how many nails it took to build the house'  What was the reaction' - Wes Dukes
Sixsigma (v.i.): To measure the unmeasurable to six decimal places of accuracy.
A cynic is an idealist who's tired.
I owe therefore I am.
Captain Bligh's Motivational Plan:   The floggings will continue until morale improves.
'Gentlemen, if we do not succeed, then we run the risk of failure.'
Author: Dan Quayle

Comment: 'A committee is twelve men doing the work of one'
Author: John Kennedy

Comment: 'One good stereotype can save you hours of original thought'
Author: John Paquette

Comment: 'I went to the museum where they had all the heads and arms from the statues that are in all the other museums.'

Comment: Corporate intellectual property is theft from man.

Comment: Artificial intelligence is better than no intelligence.

Comment: A hen is only an egg's way of making another egg.

Comment: Specialization is for insects.

Author: Attribue' `a Voltaire

Comment: The legitimate powers of government extend to such acts only as are injurious to others.  But it does me no injury for my neighbor to say there are twenty gods, or no God.  It neither picks my pocket nor breaks my leg.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Comment: I haven't lost my mind it's backed up on tape
Author: John Forkosh

Comment: Bulletin: Henceforth, sentient computers would like to be known as 'Silicon Intelligences.'  'Artificial Intelligence' is a pejorative term invented by humans based on the mistaken belief that computers are some- how not 'natural.'

Comment: Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the Universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots.  So far, the Universe is winning.
Author: Rich Cook

Comment: Our liberty depends on the freedom of the press, and that cannot be limited without being lost.
Author: Thomas Jefferson, 1786

Comment: Ubi Dubium Ibi Libertas: Where there is doubt, there is freedom.
Author: Old Latin Proverb

Comment: Absence of evidence is not evidence of absence.
Author: Carl Sagan

Comment: 'I was born a heretic.  I always distrust people who know so much about what God wants them to do to their fellows.
Author: Susan B. Anthony

Comment: I despise hate and won't stand for intolerance
Policing is only easy in a police state
Author: Austin Hill

Comment: A Freudian slip is when you say one thing but mean your mother.

Author: Richard Harkness, "The New York Times," 1960.

Comment: Slogan of 105-point-9, the classic rock radio station in Chicago - 'Of all the radio stations in Chicago, we're one of them.'

Author: Ransom K. Ferm.

Comment: Madness takes its toll. Please have exact change.

The graduate with a science degree asks, "Why does it work?"
The graduate with an engineering degree asks, "How does it work?"
The graduate with an accounting degree asks, "How much will it cost?"
The graduate with a Liberal Arts degree asks, "Do you want fries with that?"
Karate is a form of martial arts in which people who have had years and years of training can, using only their hands and feet, make some of the worst movies in the history of the world.
Author: Dave Barry

Comment: We should be careful to get out of an experience only the wisdom that is in it, and stop there; lest we be like the cat that sits down on a hot stove-lid.  She will never sit down on a hot stove-lid again - and that is well, but also she will never sit down on a cold one anymore.
Author: Mark Twain.

Comment: There's so much comedy on television. Does that cause comedy in the streets'
Author: Dick Cavett, mocking the TV violence debate.

Comment: He who fights monsters must be careful that he himself does not become one
Author: Frederick Nietzsche

Comment: As you stare into the abyss, the abyss stares back at you
Author: Frederick Nietzsche

Comment: 'The superior man understands what is right. The inferior man understands what will sell.'
Author: Confucius, philosopher

Comment: 'In Christianity neither morality nor religion come into contact with reality at any point.'
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Comment: 'Faith:  not *wanting* to know what is true.'
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Comment:
To be or not to be. - Shakespeare
To do is to be. - Nietzsche
To be is to do. - Sartre
Do be do be do. - Sinatra

God is Dead. - Nietzsche
Nietzsche is Dead. - God
What upsets me is not that you lied to me, but that from now on I can no longer believe you.
Author: Nietzsche

Comment: Whoever fights monsters should see to it that in the process he does not become a monster.  And when you look into an abyss, the abyss also looks into you.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Comment: Troll - E-definition.  (n) A loser without a life that lurks in dark places in chat rooms and message boards.  Gets off by posting deliberately provocative messages and then retreating to its lair.  Seldom seen in daylight or in the company of humans.
I hear and I forget, I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
Author: Chinese Proverb

Comment: O God, You are the source of peace, From You comes Peace, Enable me to live in peace, My Lord, o possessor of Majesty and Honor
Author: Favorite prayer of prophet Muhammad

Comment: If you don't toot your on horn, the world will use it as a spittoon
Distrust all in whom the impulse to punish is powerful.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Comment: I feel most deeply that this whole question of Creation is too profound for human intellect. A dog might as well speculate on the mind of Newton! Let each man hope and believe what he can.
Author: Charles Darwin

Comment: Ignorance more frequently begets confidence than does knowledge: it is those who know little, not those who know much, who so positively assert that this or that problem will never be solved by science.
Author: Charles Darwin

Comment: I think the environment should be put in the category of our national security. Defense of our resources is just as important as defense abroad. Otherwise what is there to defend'
Author: Robert Redford

Comment: Strategy without tactics is the slowest route to victory. Tactics without strategy is the noise before defeat.
Author: Sun Tzu

Comment: This message was written entirely with recycled electrons.
Gravity is a downer!
Watt is the unit of power'
'All the problems we face in the United States today can be traced to an unenlightened immigration policy on the part of the American Indian.'
Author: Pat Paulsen

Comment: 'Assuming either the Left Wing or the Right Wing gained control of the country, it would probably fly around in circles.'
Author: Pat Paulsen

Comment: 'I am neither left wing nor right wing. I am middle-of-the-bird.'
Author: Pat Paulsen
